metadata.title: CVE-2015-2743 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
PDF.js in Mozilla Firefox before 39.0 and Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.8 and38.x before 38.1 enables excessive privileges for internal Workers, whichmight allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging a SameOrigin Policy bypass.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
